who is albert einstein: A famous theoretical physicist known for the theory of relativity.

what is water: Water is a chemical compound made of hydrogen and oxygen (H2O).
what is fire: Fire is the visible effect of combustion, producing heat and light.
what is the sun: The Sun is the star at the center of our solar system 🌞.
what is the moon: The Moon is Earth’s only natural satellite 🌙.
what is love: Love is a deep feeling of affection, care, and connection ❤️.
what is friendship: Friendship is a bond of trust, support, and care between people.
who is the founder of microsoft: Bill Gates co-founded Microsoft with Paul Allen.
who is the founder of apple: Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne founded Apple.
who is mark zuckerberg: Mark Zuckerberg is the co-founder and CEO of Meta (formerly Facebook).
what is python: Python is a popular programming language known for simplicity and readability.
what is java: Java is a high-level, object-oriented programming language.
what is html: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, used to build web pages.
what is css: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used to style web pages.
what is javascript: JavaScript is a programming language used for web development.
joke: why did the student eat his homewo: Because the teacher said it was a piece of cake 🎂

fact: the earth is round: Yes, the Earth is an oblate spheroid 🌍.
fact: the human body has 206 bones: Correct, adults have 206 bones in their body.
fact: honey never spoils: Yes! Archaeologists found honey in tombs thousands of years old.
fact: sharks existed before trees: That’s true! Sharks are older than trees 🌳🦈
fact: bananas are berries: Yes, botanically bananas are considered berries.
fact: strawberries are not berries: Correct! Strawberries are not true berries.
fact: octopuses have three hearts: Yes, two pump blood to the gills, one to the body 🐙.
fact: goldfish have a memory span longer: Yes, they can remember things for months 🐟
fact: the Eiffel Tower can grow taller: Yes, in summer it can grow up to 15 cm taller due to heat expansion.

who was nelson mandela: Nelson Mandela was a South African leader who fought against apartheid.
who was martin luther king: Martin Luther King Jr. was a civil rights leader who fought for equality.
who was mother teresa: Mother Teresa was a missionary known for her charity work in India.
who was mahatma gandhi: Mahatma Gandhi led India’s independence movement through non-violence.
who was isaac newton: Sir Isaac Newton was a physicist and mathematician, famous for gravity.
who was leonardo da vinci: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian polymath, artist, and inventor.
who was galileo galilei: Galileo was an Italian astronomer known as the father of modern science.
who was charles darwin: Charles Darwin proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection.
who was alexander the great: Alexander the Great was a king of Macedonia who created one of the largest empires in history.
who was julius caesar: Julius Caesar was a Roman general and statesman.
who was cleopatra: Cleopatra was the last pharaoh of Ancient Egypt.
who was william shakespeare: William Shakespeare was an English playwright and poet.
who was vincent van gogh: Vincent van Gogh was a Dutch painter famous for 'Starry Night'.
who was ludwig van beethoven: Beethoven was a German composer and pianist.
who was wolfgang amadeus mozart: Mozart was a prolific and influential composer of classical music.

fact: an octopus can change color: Correct, they use chromatophores to camouflage.

who was thomas edison: Thomas Edison was an American inventor known for the light bulb.
who was nikola tesla: Nikola Tesla was an inventor known for alternating current electricity.
who was marie curie: Marie Curie discovered radioactivity and won two Nobel Prizes.
who was ada lovelace: Ada Lovelace was the first computer programmer.
who was alan turing: Alan Turing was a mathematician and computer science pioneer.
who was florence nightingale: Florence Nightingale was the founder of modern nursing.
who was abraham lincoln: Abraham Lincoln was the 16th president of the United States.
who was george washington: George Washington was the first president of the United States.
who was winston churchill: Winston Churchill was the British Prime Minister during WWII.
who was franklin d roosevelt: Franklin D. Roosevelt was the 32nd president of the United States.
